title: Everything you need to know to read Homer's "Odyssey" - Jill Dash

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the composition of the "Odyssey" poem?

options.label: A
options.text: It was written in the 8th century BCE using the Greek alphabet.

options.label: B
options.text: It was composed before the Greek alphabet appeared in the 8th century BCE and was made for listeners rather than readers.

options.label: C
options.text: It was written by a single author, Homer, over a long period of time.

options.label: D
options.text: It was composed by multiple authors in a short period of time.

multiple-choice.question: What does the word "rhapsode" mean, and what was the role of rhapsodes in ancient Greece?

options.label: A
options.text: Rhapsode means "to recite," and rhapsodes were actors who performed written texts.

options.label: B
options.text: Rhapsode means "stitching together," and rhapsodes were oral poets who combined existing stories into a single narrative.

options.label: C
options.text: Rhapsode means "to sing," and rhapsodes were musicians who performed songs.

options.label: D
options.text: Rhapsode means "to tell stories," and rhapsodes were storytellers who created new tales.

multiple-choice.question: What is the major theme uniting both the "Odyssey" and the "Iliad" poems?

options.label: A
options.text: The importance of human relationships and friendships.

options.label: B
options.text: The struggle between fate and free will.

options.label: C
options.text: Do not, under any circumstances, incur the wrath of the gods.

options.label: D
options.text: The power of love and redemption.

multiple-choice.question: What is xenia, and what role does it play in the "Odyssey"?

options.label: A
options.text: Xenia is an ancient code of warfare, and it plays a significant role in the battles described in the "Odyssey."

options.label: B
options.text: Xenia is an ancient code of hospitality, and it involves hosts providing their guests with safety, food, and comfort.

options.label: C
options.text: Xenia is an ancient code of law, and it governs the behavior of characters in the "Odyssey."

options.label: D
options.text: Xenia is an ancient code of conduct, and it guides the actions of the gods in the "Odyssey."

multiple-choice.question: How does the narrative of the "Odyssey" begin, and what is the situation of the hero, Odysseus, at the beginning of the poem?

options.label: A
options.text: The narrative begins at the end of the Trojan War, and Odysseus is returning home as a hero.

options.label: B
options.text: The narrative begins in medias res, in the middle of things, and Odysseus is trapped on an island, far from his native Ithaca.

options.label: C
options.text: The narrative begins with the birth of Odysseus, and it follows his life story from the beginning.

options.label: D
options.text: The narrative begins with Odysseus's return to Ithaca, and it tells the story of his journey through flashbacks.
